sub_title: Stress Engineer at Renault Sport F1
summary:
Mechanical Engineer with a Master of Science degree and a specialisation in the field of high-performance materials and composites. Capable to think quickly under pressure whilst being highly motivated and ambitious. All put to the test while working on a flexible schedule for three years of motorsport and structural analysis during Master’s Degree program. A never-ending thirst for knowledge in combination with creativity and inventiveness resulted in experience in engineering record-breaking and patented designs. Carries a passionate drive for producing the best vehicles in the world.

KEYWORDS:
• Composite Materials • Structural Analyst (ANSYS, Marc/Mentat, Siemens NX) • Composite Design (Siemens NX) • Programming (MATLAB/PHP/C) • Material Characterization (DSC/DMA)

HIGHLIGHTS:
• MSc thesis in filler-enhanced crashworthiness of high-performance composites
• Honours star program nomination during Bachelors
• Achieved highest Specific Energy Absorption (99J/g) ever reported for an epoxy-based composite measured in a realistic (dynamic) impact test
• Co-author of publication regarding minor project
• Several 1st Places during Formula Student season as lead structural engineer
• Realised a 59% weight reduction on transient- and heat-loaded Mercedes-Benz coupé composite engine cover

awards.title: 1st Place "Design Judging" Class 2 at Formula Student UK 2014
awards.description:
Winner of the Engineering Design Event of class 2 at the Formula Student UK 2014 Event.

The Engineering Design Event evaluates the engineering quality of all the aspects of the car as well as the overall design strategy of the competing formula student cars.

Competing in the class 2 of the 2014 Formula Student UK competition are 21 teams originating from five different countries around Europe.

awards.title: 1st Place "Overall" Class 2 at Formula Student UK 2014
awards.description:
Overall winner of the class 2 event at the Formula Student UK 2014 Event.

The overall event comprises three separate events: Design Judging, Cost Event, Presentation.

Competing in the class 2 of the 2014 Formula Student UK competition are 21 teams originating from five different countries around Europe.

awards.title: 1st Place "Acceleration" at Formula Student Spain 2013
awards.description:
Winner of the acceleration event at the Formula Student Spain 2013 Event.

The acceleration event tests the car's performance on a straight line. The acceleration is performed from a standing start on a straight of 75m. The winning time was 3.766 seconds which corresponds with a 0-100 km/h time of 2.8 seconds.

Competing in the electric class of the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition are 16 teams originating from four different countries around Europe.

awards.title: 1st Place "Design Judging" at Formula Student Spain 2013
awards.description:
Winner of the Engineering Design Event at the Formula Student Spain 2013 Event.

The Engineering Design Event evaluates the engineering quality of all the aspects of the car as well as the overall design strategy of the competing formula student cars.

Competing in the electric class of the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition are 16 teams originating from four different countries around Europe.

awards.title: 1st Place "Overall Statics" at Formula Student Spain 2013
awards.description:
Winner of the Overall Statics Award at the Formula Student Spain 2013 Event.

The Overall Statics Award combines the results of all the static events during the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition.

These static events are:

- Engineering Design Event
- Cost Report
- Business Presentation

Competing the 2013 Formula Student Spain competition are 32 teams originating from 6 different countries around the world.

awards.title: 1st Place "Skidpad" Formula Student Electric
awards.description:
Winner of the skidpad event at the Formula Student Electric 2012 Event.

In the skidpad event the car is being tested on cornering performance on a wet surface.

Competing in the Formula Student Electric competition 2012 are 32 teams originating from 8 different countries around Europe.

awards.title: Honours star program nomination
awards.description: Nominated for the Honours star program, a program for the most talented students.

awards.title: Nominal Propaedeutic diploma
awards.description: Propaedeutic diploma for passing all first year courses within one year.

projects.title: Filler-enhanced crashworthiness of high-performance composites
projects.description: In this project, the impact performance of the composite is isolated by taking a micro-scale approach, which begins with characterisation of the intrinsic deformation behaviour of the neat polymer matrix. Studying this intrinsic response via uniaxial compression tests, allows us to quantify post-yield characteristics as localisation is absent. In order to provide understanding in the effect of various fillers on impact performance, Representative Volume Elements are analysed in which the intrinsic polymer behaviour is modelled with the use of a non-linear viscoelastic-plastic model. These results are subsequently brought into practice by application to impact tests of CFRP crash tubes, thereby generating the highest Specific Energy Absorption ever reported for epoxy-based composites.

contributors.headline: Stress Engineer at Renault Sport F1

publications.name: Alternating Ring-Opening Polymerization of Cyclohexene Oxide and Anhydrides: Effect of Catalyst, Cocatalyst, and Anhydride Structure

authors.headline: Stress Engineer at Renault Sport F1

profile_positions.description:
Provided Classical Laminate Theory (stress and failure) analysis and calculations by hand on complex-shaped, highly loaded composite components for various OEMs: Mercedes-Benz, Audi and BMW. Products are mainly designed with implementation of Fibre-Reinforced Plastics, e.g., Carbon-Fibre-Reinforced Plastics. Liaised with design, manufacturing and commercial departments whilst continuously reporting to supervisors and managers.

Conducted implicit non-linear contact analysis and structural design on Mercedes-Benz coupé middle engine cover and realised a 59% weight reduction, component displayed at JEC Europe 2014 conference in Paris.  

Part-time job during college in order to fund tuition and build financial buffer.
profile_positions.title: Stress / Structural Analysis Engineer (part-time)

profile_positions.description:
External industrial placement at a tier 1 supplier for Mercedes-Benz with 480+ employees which specialises in plastic products in the automotive industry.

Conducted research and development activities on bonding techniques of composite structures and successfully reduced cost by 17%. Worked in close collaboration with manufacturing and quality control departments whilst reporting to manager.

Research topic: ‘Bonding of EASI2 components for implementation in the automotive industry’, graded 8/10 (A)
profile_positions.title: Research and Development Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Conducted design, analysis and production of the Front Impact Attenuator for the URE08, URE09 and URE10 Formula Student racecar, manufactured with the use of high-performance CFRP. Consequently responsible for designing the associated tooling requirements, production techniques and processes. Also conducted design, production, and maintenance of the high-voltage accumulator system and drivetrain with high attention to detail and focus on reliability. 

Achieved highest Specific Energy Absorption in Formula Student competition of Germany ('13, '14, '15), Spain ('13, '14, '15), United Kingdom ('14, '15) and Austria ('15).
profile_positions.title: Team member University Racing Eindhoven

profile_positions.description:
University Racing Eindhoven is the multicultural and multidisciplinary Formula Student racing team of Eindhoven University of Technology. During one year an award-winning formula-type electric race car with full CFRP monocoque was designed, built and tested to compete in the Formula Student competition. 

Responsibilities and functions included:
-	Lead URE08 & URE09 monocoque design (3D CAD), stress analysis (FEA) and lay-up optimisation.
-	Lead composite design, analysis and production of: drive shaft, battery casing and motor enclosure.
-	Assist design and analysis of: hybrid metal-composite rim, aero package, side pods and firewall.
-	Define resin systems, reinforcement materials and layup for above mentioned components.
-	Specification and documentation of test requests according to time and budget.

Weight savings realised for each respective part in comparison with preceding design: monocoque (40%), drive shaft (49%), catch can (89%), metal-composite rim (43%), firewall (54%) and front impact attenuator (72%).
profile_positions.title: Lead Stress / Structural Analysis Engineer

profile_positions.description: Guiding and teaching secondary school students in physics, mathematics and chemistry.
profile_positions.title: Private Tutor

profile_positions.description:
Started as assistant-chef, gained communicative and collaborative skills and was promoted to all-round manager of up to 20 colleagues. Functioned as lead organiser of events with up to 600 visitors and functioned as assistant organiser of events with up to 1500 visitors.

Full time occupation from Jul 2010 – Sep 2011 between BSc. and MSc. in order to gain financial buffer
profile_positions.title: Assistant Restaurant Manager
